plot: T*$\varepsilon$ -- Bounded-Suboptimal Efficient Motion Planning for Minimum-Time Planar Curvature-Constrained Systems
summary:
They consider the problem of finding collision-free paths for curvature-constrained systems in the presence of obstacles while minimizing execution time. They focus on the setting where a planar system can travel at some range of speeds with unbounded acceleration. This setting can model many systems, such as fixed-wing drones.
 They show that by finding bounded-suboptimal solutions, one can dramatically reduce the number of time-optimal transitions used. They demonstrate using empirical evaluation that the planning framework can reduce the runtime by several orders of magnitude compared to the state-of-the-art while still providing guarantees on the quality of the solution.
